name: Strawberry-Moscato Sorbet
description: This sorbet is an easy, elegant finish to a summer dinner. A good sorbet should taste like an extraction of its main flavor, and nothing else. It should be gutsier than ice cream, and purer; there is no custard to compete with. But while sorbets are easy to make, they are also unforgiving, and require the best fruit you can find. For this recipe, you’ll want to use the sweetest, ripest strawberries available, as the fruit’s flavor is mostly the point here.
recipeCategory: quick, weekday, ice creams and sorbets
keywords: dairy-free, low-fat, nut-free, dessert, moscato, orange juice, strawberry, summer

recipeInstructions.text: In a food processor, puree strawberries. Add moscato, orange juice, sugar, corn syrup and 1 1/2 cups water. Puree. Strain through a fine sieve. Taste, adding sugar if necessary. Chill in refrigerator.
Stir mixture, then pour into an ice cream maker and follow manufacturer's instructions.
